prompt: "You can't trust John's opinion on climate change - he failed chemistry in high school."
hint: This argument attacks the person making the claim rather than the claim itself.
explanation: This is an Ad Hominem fallacy - attacking John's character (his high school grades) instead of addressing his actual argument about climate change. A person's past academic performance doesn't automatically invalidate their current opinions.
visual_concept: Ad Hominem: Instead of fighting the argument (a shield), someone attacks the person holding it (throws mud at them).
